Note by the Secretary of State for the Colonies.The following telegram to the Governor General of the Commonwealth of Australia is circulated with reference to CP.19(25).COLONIAL OFFICE.January 25, 1925.(Intd) L.8.A.Telegram from the Secretary of State for the Colonies to the Governor General of the Commonwealth of Australia. Sent 22nd January, 1925.Confidential.Your telegram 3th of January, His Majesty's Government thank Commonwealth Government for information and assume that "by restoration of gold standard no more is meant than abolition of export prohibition on gold. This formal step would not seem to be urgent since as Commonwealth Government observe present conditions point rather to import of gold.As regards last sentence of your telegram, policy of His Majesty^ Government is as it has always been to restore gold standard as soon as possible. While no definite decision has yet been taken it is not improbable that it may be necessary to make some announcement within next two months, more particularly in viuw of expiration on 31st Decem-ber 1925 of the existing power to prohibit export of gold from United Kingdom.
